intro: Strobilanthes leucopogon, commonly known as the white-haired strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Strobilanthes leucopogon is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
